alert.note: Alert for Cody Foothills; North Big Horn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 15 at 10:09PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...Light Snow and Gusty Winds Starting Wednesday Evening... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...Light to moderate snow. Accumulations of 1 to 2 inches. Locally higher amounts of 2 to 4 inches near Cody, Meeteetse, and Clark. North wind gusting 30 to 40 mph will lead to blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Northern portions of the Bighorn Basin and the Absaroka Mountains. * WHEN...6 PM Wednesday to 12 PM Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Travel on roadways, especially US Highway 16 between Cody and Greybull and along Wyoming Highway 120, will be impacted by winter driving conditions and lowered visibility at times Wednesday night into Thursday morning. Blowing and drifting snow will occur.

area.areaDesc: Cody Foothills; North Big Horn Basin
